oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Robinson's Drugstore
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Street view of Robinson's Drugstore in Dayton.

Fred Robinson, the drugstore owner, attempted to capitalize on the Scopes trial by proudly advertising his drugstore as the place "where it started." John Scopes and town officials met here and posed for photographs for the media. The drugstore went out of; business in 1982.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Drugstores; Stores & shops; Storefronts; Signs (Notices)
